AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa: defendant in a case involving illegal re-entry after deportation, sentenced to 90 months of imprisonment, native and citizen of Mexico, signed the Plea Agreement and Plea Agreement Addendum, pleaded guilty before a United States Magistrate Judge, has a history of violating immigration laws including aiding and abetting the illegal reentry of undocumented aliens and transportation of undocumented aliens for private financial gain, claims his counsel was ineffective, waived the right to appeal the sentence imposed, knowingly and voluntarily pleaded guilty, made a credible showing of deficient performance on the part of his counsel, understood the rights he was giving up by pleading guilty, confirmed under oath that his plea was knowing and voluntary, appellant, has a family situation and is a member of a gang, complained about counsel's effectiveness at sentencing, has a criminal history, claims to be a United States citizen, admitted to illegally re-entering the United States to reunite with his family in Laredo, Texas, applied for derivative citizenship with the Department of Homeland Security/citizenship and Immigration Services
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: the government entity involved in the prosecution of Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Attorney General: government official responsible for permission to re-enter the United States, authorized early disposition programs
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Secretary of the Department of Homeland: government official responsible for permission to re-enter the United States
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Kazen: Senior United States District Judge who entered an Order adopting the Report and Recommendation of the United States Magistrate Judge, presiding over Valero's case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.counsel: Valero's lawyer, helped Valero understand the rights he was giving up by pleading guilty, rendered effective assistance according to Valero's express acknowledgment, subject to standards that consider the acuity of hindsight and the art of representation, failed to rely on Guidelines Amendment 742 for calculation of criminal history points at sentencing, allegedly made an error in Ground Three which is not an attack on the validity of the waiver or the plea, did not provide deficient performance by failing to ask for early disposition program benefits, assisted the defendant with his application for derivative citizenship
